ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developed a better understanding of German and had the opportunity to practice using the language.

I learned how to express myself in German on many topics, including feelings, daily life, interests, hobbies, and even political opinions. I began to develop an ear for German speaking and improved upon my vocabulary knowledge. I learned about German culture through writing email partners and various projects in our course.
More advanced knowledge of German language

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think some of the work felt like "busy work" and I wish we spent more time on the grammatical structures.  Also, I found that most of the vocab in a chapter in the book wasn't actually relevant for the test, but some on a specific topic was very important.  Once I figured out how to study, this was alright, but I think it was hard at first.

While writing and daily conversation among students and the teacher were integral to my growth. This helped to solidify the concepts I had been learning from the previous semester. I feel that I truly began to consider how to use German functionally and became much more comfortable with trying to express myself in German despite issues in my speech or failing to fully express myself. I thought the connect homework assignments were wholly and totally useless. These assignments regularly took over an hour each time, and were nothing more than busy work which felt tedious and busy. I failed to grasp most of the concepts these assignments taught.
It could be focused more on reinforcing concepts rather than participating in various tangential projects.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes.  It is intense, and sometimes it does feel hard to know how to succeed in the course.  But overall I thought it was good, especially with Shila.
Yes, I think the course is great for preparing students at the A2 level, but I would caveat my recommendation with a note that this course takes a notable in jump in the weekly expectations of work.
Yes, those who need or want to learn German should absolutely go for it and especially whet Shila Rahmani is an instructor
